text: hello this bill cunningham reporting
from the Conservancy Garden of Central
Park this is a ritual luncheon for the
women's Conservancy or Central Park
which raises money attended by 1200
people and for some reason over the
years it evolved from very plain little
hats when women needs to wear hats 30 32
years ago to very extravagant hats now
it's not lessening it's it this year was
more than ever and it's archaic in a way
the fashion world it gives them a case
of the vapors because it's not at all
what they're thinking about in fashion
but this these are close real people
wear and on this particular occasion
they add a very fanciful hat or
headdress this year what struck me
fashion wise were the hats that look
like satellite dishes worn it normally
rakish angles that defy gravity and they
won't simply marvelous in the 1930s late
30s there was a rage this kind of hat
and they were called profile hats
because they would dip down on the right
side and you see the most wonderful
profile of women now fashion wise what
struck me was the emergence of
reemergence of Dior's new look women are
taking to that 1947 nip waste natural
small shoulder and full skirts and I saw
several examples of variations some of
the women are wearing the silhouette the
nipped in shaped waist but the skirts
are mini skirts so they almost look like
bird cages it's a very interesting
development the other thing with the
shaping of the jackets look at them I
mean
we haven't seen anything like that in a
long time and a lot of people say let's
hope we don't because it takes a lot of
tailoring and fitting and you have to
keep your body in shape now even Chanel
they kept the skirts knee length but
they were fuller they were nipped in at
the waist you need a waist cincher and
they had little flyaway jackets meaning
they were very loose either in the back
or all around and short bell-like
sleeves so there was fashion news there
there's no question about it
